intro: Uvaria paraneglecta, commonly known as the slender uvaria, is a tropical shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn dark when mature. Uvaria paraneglecta is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests.
